alert.note: Alert for Boulder; Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 11:24PM MDT until May 10 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in north central Colorado, Larimer. In northeast Colorado, Boulder and Weld. * WHEN...Until 230 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1124 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greeley, northern Boulder, Longmont, northern Broomfield, Lafayette, Evans, Erie, Firestone, Johnstown, Frederick, Milliken, Berthoud, Dacono, Mead, Lyons, LaSalle, Gilcrest, Niwot, Carter Lake and Garden City.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
